result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendale D Allen

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. DPA Violation 11.4.22

Defendant Kendale D Allen in court.  Attorney Paige Aleece Styler in court for Kendale D Allen.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders the warrant canceled. Defendant has a new pending case in Waukesha. Defense reports that the defendant may qualify for DTC and requests a staffing. Court offered defendant a verbal admonishment regarding recent JusticePoint violation reports. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
received and filed.
received and filed.

Defendant Kendale D Allen not in court.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent in court for Kendale D Allen.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference to address deferred prosecution agreement violation. Defendant failing to appear, Court informs parties that the Bench Warrant will remain in effect. Case remains calendared as previously set for a review hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Kendale D Allen not in court.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent in court for Kendale D Allen.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Justice Point Hearing. Defense counsel provides an update to the court. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO BRANCH 17. Court further takes no action as to bail. Court vacates 11/01/2022 calendar call date and converts this matter to a status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 17.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO BRANCH 17 ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Received and Filed. DPA Violation 10/6/22

Defendant Kendale D Allen not in court.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent appeared by video for Kendale D Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for calendar call to address non-compliance and missed court date. Statements by defense regarding defendant's non-appearance. State has no objection of continuance of stayed warrant. Court granted and orders the bench warrant stayed to the next court date.
Calendar call scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kendale D Allen not in court.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent in court for Kendale D Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled to address non-compliance. Statements by defense regarding defendants non-appearance. Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant. State defers to the Court. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance for an in-person calendar call date.
Calendar call scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DPA Supervision Report

Court was contacted by parties requesting an earlier hearing date to address defendant's compliance with the DPA. Court scheduled hearing with parties via email correspondence on September 26th, 2022 at 10:50 AM.

Defendant Kendale D Allen in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in compliance with the terms of the agreement. Defendant needs to complete the community service hours in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 8.1.22

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received and filed.

Parties not able to sign plea questionnaire and agreement due to current circumstances. Court accepts verbal agreement from all parties.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Kendale D Allen in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights Form and Addendum
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions
received and filed.
